item.title: Schedule
item.description:
Schedule#

Note:The schedule below is tentative and subject to change.

Important Links (Assignment Related)#

Paper Presentations
  • Google Slides Template:LINK
  • Due by 5pm the day before your presentation (Piazza post with slides and discussion topics).
'Implement Something' Assignment / Presentation
  • Details coming soon.
Final Project
  • Details coming soon.

ðŸ§­ Module 1: Fundamentals#

Class 1 â€” Tue, Jan 20, 2026
Topic:Introduction
Goal:(to be filled)

  • Slides:LINK
Class 2 â€” Thu, Jan 22, 2026
Topic:The Paper "Draft" & Fundamentals Primer
Goal:Sign up for paper presentations and a quick review of common terms and formulations used in the robotics literature.

  • Slides:LINK
Additional Resources:
  • Springer Handbook of Robotics
Class 3 â€” Tue, Jan 27, 2026
Topic:Fundamentals 1:The Needs and Opportunities of Robots
Goal:We will start with a broad perspective about opportunities for robots and research progress over a longer horizon.

  • Collaborative Robots and Industrial Revolution 4.0 (IR 4.0)
  • The Evolution of Robotics Research â€” From Industrial Robotics to Field and Service Robotics
Class 4 â€” Thu, Jan 29, 2026
Topic:Fundamentals 2:Moving Your Robot & System Complexity
Goal:Robot research often involves deploying full-stack systems and inverse kinematics techniques.

  • DexPilot:Vision-Based Teleoperation of Dexterous Robotic Handâ€“Arm Systems
  • RelaxedIK:Real-time Synthesis of Accurate and Feasible Robot Arm Motion
Class 5 â€” Tue, Feb 3, 2026
Topic:Fundamentals 3:Planning Motions
Goal:Review of common planning techniques and modern optimization-based approaches.

  • Motion Planning:The Essentials
  • Motion Planning Around Obstacles with Convex Optimization
Additional Resources:
  • Collision-Affording Point Trees(recent high-performance path planning RSS paper)

ðŸ¤– Module 2: Learning#

Class 6 â€” Thu, Feb 5, 2026
Topic:Learning Primer
Goal:Review high-level robot learning architectures and approaches.

  • Slides:LINK
Additional Resources:
  • ALVINN:An Autonomous Land Vehicle in a Neural Network(original BC paper)
Class 7 â€” Tue, Feb 10, 2026
Topic:Learning 1:Foundations
Goal:Review classical learning techniques including movement primitives and behavior cloning.

  • Movement Primitives
  • Behavioral Cloning from Observation
Additional Resources:
  • Generative Adversarial Imitation Learning
Class 8 â€” Thu, Feb 12, 2026
Topic:Learning 2:End-to-End & Meta-Learning
Goal:End-to-end learning and early meta-learning approaches for generalization.

  • End-to-End Learning
  • Model-Agnostic Meta-Learning
Class 9 â€” Tue, Feb 17, 2026
Topic:Learning 3:Intermediate Representations
Goal:Learning with inferred reward functions and hierarchical correction.

  • Maximum Entropy Inverse Reinforcement Learning
  • Yell At Your Robot
Class 10 â€” Thu, Feb 19, 2026
Topic:Literature Review Workshop
Goal:Strategies for finding and evaluating robotics research.

  • Slides:LINK
Class 11 â€” Tue, Feb 24, 2026
Topic:Learning 4:The Rise of Generative Learning
Goal:Inflection point papers in generative robotics.

  • Do As I Can, Not As I Say
  • Diffusion Policy
Class 12 â€” Thu, Feb 26, 2026
Topic:Learning 5:Practical Considerations
Goal:Small design choices that impact learning systems.

  • What Matters in Learning from Offline Data
  • Continuity of Rotation Representations
Additional Resources:
  • Much Ado About Noising
Class 13 â€” Tue, Mar 3, 2026
Topic:Learning 6:Frontiers
Goal:(to be filled)

  • Ï€âˆ—0.6
  • mimic-video
